description: From French prude, from Old French prude, prode, feminine of prou, prod, prud (“good, excellent, brave”), from Latin prōde. Related to proud but unrelated to prudent.

adjectives.description: prude (comparative more prude, superlative most prude)

entries.meaning: A person who is or tries to be excessively proper, especially one who is easily offended by matters of a sexual nature.
examples: He became shy. "I hadn't meant to tell you. It's not quite for a lady." For, like most men who are rather animal, he was intellectually a prude.
